name: Certificate of Graduate Study in Reading & Writing Literacy

Certificate of Graduate Study in Reading: Certificate of Graduate Study in Reading & Writing Literacy This hybrid program meets the increasing need for highly qualified practitioners in the area of Reading & Writing Literacy as required by the Common Core English and Language Arts Standards. This program benefits classroom teachers P-12 who wish to increase their knowledge of literacy instruction. Courses in this program also enable teachers to apply for National Board Certification by building content area knowledge in reading and writing. The Certificate of Graduate Study in Reading & Writing Literacy does not lead to any state certification. All courses carry over to either the Master of Arts in Writing or the Master of Arts in Reading as appropriate. Admission Requirements Completed Post-baccalaureate/Graduate/Doctoral Application Form (www.rowanu.com/graduate/apply) $65 (U.S.) non-refundable application fee Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution of higher learning Official transcripts from all colleges attended (regardless of number of credits earned) Current professional resume Statement of professional objectives One letter of recommendation that address potential as a leader and potential for graduate study Minimum GPA of 2.75 (on a 4.0 scale)

To maintain satisfactory academic progress and to successfully complete the program, students must: Earn a B- or better in all coursework.
